title: Will the Imperium of Man survive the grim darkness of the far future, and how? - Quora

response.answer_text: Will the Imperium of Man survive the grim darkness of the far future, and how? No. They’ve already set it in stone as canon back in the Horus Heresy series. If Horus had killed the emperor, he would’ve gone into grieving, then in his rage, he would have destroyed the chaos gods. If he failed to kill the emperor, then the imperium would limp along for the next ten thousand years or so, and eventually be consumed by Slaanesh. That was about ten thousand years ago in the timeline. Tick tock, time’s running out. Mankind is absolutely screwed though in that setting, but it won’t happen during the timeframe the game’s covering. They’ll probably just use it as a last moment “we’re closing our studio, Slaanesh noms everything, done.” But yeah, it’s been stated that way quite awhile ago. There’s no escaping that fate, only temporarily postponing it.
